column4: Could someone help me install XChat? I've never installed anything while in Ubuntu before
Open the synaptic package manager located under system>administration
Or you can do what secion said.
Click in that right frame, then begin typing Xchat.
When you see it, check the box next to it and then click apply at the top.
Unless you don't have all of your sources enabled.
I would assume that you wouldn't see -common without xchat though...
I'm only able to check mark it for removal
Well, try going to System>Administration>Software Sources, then.
Are the four first boxes checked on the first tab?
Then hit close and return to the Synaptic Package Manager.
Back in Synaptic, click reload and then look for xchat again.
If it asks to install other stuff with it click ok/yes
